Title: Junior – Operations Excellence AI/GenAI
Description:
Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team di Operations Excellence di Deloitte sulla sede di Milano, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

All’interno del team avrai l’occasione di crescere occupandoti di supportare la trasformazione delle istituzioni finanziarie per le quali lavoriamo a seguito di esigenze che possono nascere dal business e contesto di mercato del cliente e/o da adeguamenti degli stessi dettati dal rispetto e aderenza alle normative bancarie/assicurative. In particolare ti occuperai di concretizzare le esigenze strategiche dei nostri clienti attraverso progetti fortemente innovativi che coprono tutta la value chain aziendale e spaziano su molteplici ambiti di competenze eterogenee e multidisciplinari.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sarà inserita all'interno di un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:


Lavorare a stretto contatto con il team e con i clienti per comprendere le esigenze di business e tradurle in metodologie ed approcci coerenti ad esse;
Sviluppo e gestione dell’innovazione tecnologica e strategica;
Lavorare in ambito analytics ed in progetti di digitalizzazione utilizzando strumenti e tecnologie di tendenza come data management, automatizzazione dei processi, Gen AI ecc…
Supportare i clienti nell’analisi attraverso l’elaborazione e la gestione delle basi informative per identificare trend, pattern e insight rilevanti; e nella visualizzazione dei dati attraverso il disegno e lo sviluppo di report e dashboard.


Winning Requirements


Laurea/Master in ambito STEM;
Interesse per tecnologie e strumenti di AI/Gen AI, Data Management, Data Visualization (Tableau, Power BI o Qlik); e cloud computing;
Conoscenza di almeno un linguaggio di programmazione (tra SQL, Python, R). Rappresenterebbe un must la conoscenza di librerie specifiche, come Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, SciPy ecc…
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese;
Buona conoscenza del Pacchetto Office (Excel, PPT);
Forte motivazione a sviluppare competenze nel campo dei dati, dall'acquisizione all'analisi e presentazione e curiosità per le nuove tecnologie e le tendenze del settore.


Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.
Show more

Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern


Quantitative modelling of business processes
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients –
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive


What You Need To Know


Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
Fluent English


We Are Looking For Someone Who


is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist to join a global consultancy team and support the rollout of a cutting-edge data reduction system for a prominent pharma client. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a large-scale data strategy, helping to shape data structures, integrate data, and develop new analytical functionalities to enhance data visualization.




As part of the Data Strategy & Reduction Group, you will play a pivotal role in improving analytical capabilities, ensuring robust data transformation, and enabling seamless integration across systems. Your work will directly support the broader data strategy, delivering actionable insights and driving innovation in the pharmaceutical sector.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and optimize data models to support data reduction and insights generation.
Manage and integrate efficient data pipelines.
Collaborate with business analysts to understand data requirements and provide effective technical solutions.
Implement advanced analytical models and statistical techniques to enhance data processing and visualization, specifically within Spotfire.
Design and deploy automated workflows for scalable, impactful insights.
Contribute to data quality initiatives, including anomaly detection, data cleansing, and validation.
Develop and refine best practices for data science applications in a pharmaceutical environment.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior team members (if applicable).




What We're Looking For:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Bioinformatics).
3+ years of experience in data science, preferably in the life sciences or pharmaceutical sector.
Strong expertise in data management, visualization, and analytics concepts.
Proficiency with Tibco software platform, especially for data visualization (Tibco Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI are a plus).
Solid programming skills in Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with large datasets, ETL processes, and optimizing data pipelines.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data challenges into clear, actionable solutions.
Strong communication skills and the ability to present technical insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English (French is a plus).
Availability to work from the office at least once a week.
Experience with cloud-based platforms and agile methodologies is an advantage.
Familiarity with laboratory workflows, scientific data handling, and regulatory standards is desirable.




Contract Details

6-12 month Contract (Extendable)
Work with leading Pharma
Daily Rate: 350€-400€
Start Date: May 2025
Interviews as soon as possible




Interested? Apply Now!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :


Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate


The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:

The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:


Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for

Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
New commercial offers
Customer behavior analysis

Ensure the run of models and derived operations
Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
Promote good practice, especially around data and code
Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team

Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
Practical thinking, hands-on approach
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way

Good to have:

Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus

Soft skills:


Must have:

Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together




Good to have:

Practical thinking

Education and professional background:


University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity & gas markets


Languages:


F lu ent in En g lish


Travels:


Occasional travels (mostly to CWE countries)


If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Division: GEMS - EC QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH & MODELING

Legal Entity: ELECTRABEL

Professional Experience: Skilled ( >3 experience <15 years)

Education Level: Master's Degree

HTML:
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise:

  • Asset management
  • Energy transition services
  • Energy supply & global commodities
  • Risk management & market access

At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Deep understanding of LLMs fine-tuning and/or training lifecycle (LLMops).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sibling is looking for a Data Scientist for a leading insurer in Brussels, Belgium. This will be a long-term freelance assignment.




Role




Designing, developing, and implementing AI/data-driven solutions tailored to business needs using internal and external data.
Extracting and communicating actionable insights to support decision-making and problem-solving.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify and address data-related challenges.
Continuously monitoring model accuracy and proactively identifying and fixing issues or data drifts.




Skills




At least 5 years of experience in data analysis, ideally within a commercial/business context.
Hands-on expertise in AI, GenAI, computer vision, NLP, and/or deep learning.
Advanced skills in Python, SQL, Power BI, and Databricks.
Excellent communication skills – you can clearly present complex data to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluency in French or Dutch, and English.
Hybrid Working




Please, get in touch

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
(Medical R&D Sector – Confidential Client)




About the role




On behalf of one of our clients — a leading innovator in the medical research and development sector (Software and ML integrated Product)— we are recruiting for two open positions within the same dynamic R&D team:

Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Medior Machine Learning Engineer




This company is dedicated to improving healthcare outcomes through advanced statistical analysis and machine learning innovation. The ideal candidates will have a strong technical foundation, a passion for scientific research, and a deep interest in applying AI to solve meaningful real-world challenges in the healthcare domain.




Responsibilities

Research, design, and implement new machine learning models to enhance clinical data quality and support healthcare decision-making.
Continuously analyze scientific literature to identify promising algorithms and evaluate their practical application.
Produce robust, efficient Python code aligned with best software development practices.
Leverage open-source libraries and frameworks to drive experimentation and model optimization.
Apply best practices for experiment tracking, model validation, and deployment.
Explore new areas for machine learning applications in the medical and clinical research domain.
Actively contribute to scientific visibility through conferences, workshops, and potential publications.
Collaborate closely with data engineers, domain experts, and statisticians to bring prototypes into production.




Profile Sought

Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
Solid professional experience in machine learning, data science, or applied AI roles.
Excellent command of Python.
Practical experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Comfortable with Git and collaborative development workflows.
Proven ability to translate theoretical research into operational AI solutions.
Language requirements: Fluent English is sufficient; no other languages are required




Nice to Have

Experience with deep learning and natural language processing (NLP).
Practical experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
Previous exposure to medical data or work in highly regulated industries (healthcare, life sciences, etc.).
Knowledge of GPU computing environments.




Offer

Two open roles: one Senior and one Medior Machine Learning Engineer.
Remote-first working model: nearly fully remote; only 1 day/week minimum presence on-site South Brussels
Opportunity to work on scientifically impactful projects with real-world healthcare applications.
Competitive salary package including bonuses, mobility benefits, healthcare insurance, and more.
Dynamic, multicultural team environment focused on research excellence, technical innovation, and personal development.
Access to powerful computing infrastructure, learning materials, and career growth opportunities.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🌍 Freelance Data Scientist – Remote (EU-based)




We’re looking for a highly skilled Freelance Data Scientist to support an innovative project at the intersection of Generative AI and traditional machine learning. If you thrive in fast-paced environments, enjoy building impactful models, and have hands-on experience with Databricks, this could be a great match.




🔧 What you’ll be doing:

Collaborating with data experts to identify business opportunities
Designing and implementing ML models for predictive analytics, anomaly detection, and more
Leveraging Databricks, Python/R, and MLflow to develop and deploy scalable solutions
Applying both Generative AI (LLMs, NLP) and traditional ML approaches
Communicating insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders




✅ What you’ll need:

Proven experience as a Data Scientist (freelance or contract experience a plus)
Strong knowledge of Databricks, Apache Spark, or PySpark
Solid background in Generative AI, LLMs, and NLP
Proficiency in Python or R, including libraries like pandas, NumPy, and scikit-learn
Familiarity with MLflow, Delta Lake, or other lakehouse tools
EU residency and eligibility to work on a B2B/freelance basis

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Position Overview




We are seeking a skilled MLOps Engineer / AI Engineer to join our team in Brussels. In this role, you will be instrumental in bridging the gap between Data Science initiatives and IT operations. You will focus on the deployment, monitoring, and optimization of machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring smooth integration into organizational infrastructure. Additionally, you will be involved in lifecycle management, scalability improvements, and performance optimization of AI systems.




Key Responsibilities




Model Deployment: Work closely with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models into production, adhering to best practices in security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated, efficient data pipelines to enable continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Support project teams by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment workflows.
Data Flow Design: Build and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage solutions, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI-driven applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Utilize Kubernetes to manage the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource usage and system reliability.
Incident Management: Respond promptly to incidents, troubleshoot technical issues, communicate updates to stakeholders, and conduct root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Investigate and implement innovative solutions to improve AI capabilities and streamline model integration.




Requirements




Education

Solid knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.




Technical Expertise

Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have: Experience with SQL, PostgreSQL, MLflow, and Helm charts.




Soft Skills

Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.




Language Proficiency

Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Proficiency in Dutch or French is required.







If this opportunity is interesting for you, please forward your CV to Lkiani@montash.be OR simply apply via LinkedIn.

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.


We offer

As a Certified Top Employer We Offer


An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.

Title: Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients.

Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE’s core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients’ most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Willingness to travel up to 50%
Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred
Show more
HTML:
Who You'll Work With

You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients.

Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE’s core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients’ most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Your Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
  • Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
  • Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
  • Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
  • Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
  • Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
  • Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
  • Strong interpersonal communication skills
  • Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
  • Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
  • Willingness to travel up to 50%
  • Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.




What will be your tasks with us ?

You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production:

Analyze and interpret complex datasets to uncover insights and inform decision-making

Develop and implement machine learning models for predictive analytics, classification, regression, etc

Work with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data science solutions

Clean, preprocess, and transform raw data into structured formats suitable for analysis

Design and run experiments to test hypotheses and validate model effectiveness

Communicate findings and insights through visualizations, reports, and presentations to non-technical stakeholders

Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., engineers, analysts) to integrate data science models into production systems




Profile

You have a Master in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have minimum 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist

You have experience delivering end-to-end projects, from research, POC to Production

You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for example) and Data visualization tools

Proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases

Experience with big data such as Pyspark, Spark and Hadoop.

You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)

You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), testing, use of CI/CD tools

You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Generative AI, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT

Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!

Fluent in English and Dutch and/or French

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a company that’s transforming healthcare?




Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimize rebates, and drive better value.




As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.




We’re looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology— all to align business goals with technical capabilities.




At Lyfegen, we’re tackling challenges no one has solved before. That’s why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset—people who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.




Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Machine learning and NLP expertise:
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.







What we offer:

Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.
Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
A leading name within pharmaceuticals requires a Lead AI Engineer to join their expanding regional team. The successful candidate will help build a distributed AI team aimed at transforming enterprise processes. Ideal candidates have overseen the launch of AI-driven tools involving structured/unstructured data, graph/vector databases, and intuitive interfaces. Familiarity with agent-based AI, robust operational pipelines, and ethical AI governance is key.




Responsibilities:

Define and lead the roadmap for generative AI capabilities aligned with strategic goals.

Recruit and mentor global AI talent and manage budgets and delivery teams.

Stay current on GenAI trends and research, guide architecture decisions, and implementation.

Partner with business and technical teams to define impactful use cases.

Champion modern engineering workflows (DevOps/LLMOps) and scalable solutions.




Ideal Candidate:

Advanced degree (PhD preferred) in STEM or related field.

Proven experience in leading AI teams and projects.

Cloud platforms (Azure preferred) and related AI services.

Deep knowledge of LLM libraries (e.g., LangChain, Semantic Kernel, Autogen).

Strong engineering skills, API/backend/frontend experience.

Familiarity with CI/CD, observability tools, and AI model monitoring.




If this role sounds like a good match to your skillset and you would like to learn more, please apply.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken?




Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)?




Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?




Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt ervaring als tech lead in een nieuwe start-up omgeving.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?




Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Job Title: AI Engineer




Location: Remote




My client at the forefront of AI innovation, working on groundbreaking projects that push the limits of what artificial intelligence can achieve. We are looking for a skilled Generative AI Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us develop cutting-edge AI models using TensorFlow and PyTorch.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and optimize AI models.
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to integrate models into real-world applications.
Develop and maintain TensorFlow and PyTorch-based solutions.
Experiment with and enhance current generative models to improve accuracy and performance.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI research and best practices.




Required Skills & Experience:

Proficiency in TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and neural networks.
Experience with generative models
Solid programming skills in Python.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Familiarity with cloud-based platforms is a plus.




🔗 Apply now or message me directly for more details about the role!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge tech with cinematic magic.




Position: Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Remote in Europe

Salary up to $90,000




You will build and deploy AI models that power groundbreaking filmmaking tools. Collaborate globally, code with precision, and drive innovation through data-driven testing.




Role:

Craft robust and efficient machine learning pipelines tailored for filmmaking applications.
Deliver clean, well-documented, and maintainable Python code.
Conduct rigorous A/B testing and performance analysis to optimize models and ensure they meet key metrics.
Ensure models are deployed effectively in production environments, leveraging cloud services and containerization.




Qualifications:

Deep Python/PyTorch expertise
3+ years relevant ML experience
Experienced with 3D Mesh
Big bonus if you have GenAI Experience i.e. Flux, Stable Diffusion

Title: AI-Engineer
Description:
LACO is een toonaangevend data-intelligentiebedrijf met meer dan 35 jaar expertise in data engineering, analytics en AI. Wij helpen organisaties bij het omzetten van data in waardevolle inzichten en ondersteunen hen in hun digitale transformatie.




Wat ga je doen?

Als AI-Engineer ben jij de technische spil in het ontwikkelen en implementeren van AI-oplossingen op het Azure-platform. Je werkt nauw samen met data scientists, data engineers en softwareontwikkelaars om schaalbare en betrouwbare AI-modellen te bouwen, finetunen en integreren in de productie omgeving.




Je bent verantwoordelijk voor:

Het deployen van machine learning modellen via Azure Machine Learning.
Het ontwikkelen van pipelines voor data-inname, modeltraining en deployment (CI/CD).
Het monitoren, bijsturen en onderhouden van AI-oplossingen in productie.
Het toepassen van responsible AI-principes zoals fairness, explainability en privacy.
Samenwerken met stakeholders om AI-mogelijkheden om te zetten in waardevolle toepassingen.




Wat neem je mee?

🎓 Vereiste vaardigheden en ervaring:

Bachelor of Master in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science of vergelijkbaar.
Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als AI-engineer of ML engineer.
Ervaring met Python en ML-frameworks zoals scikit-learn, TensorFlow of PyTorch.

Aantoonbare ervaring met Microsoft Azure, met name:

Azure Machine Learning (AML)
Azure Data Lake / Data Factory
Azure Cognitive Services
Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions
Azure Kubernetes Services (AKS) voor modeldeployment (pré)
Ervaring met MLOps-praktijken: versiebeheer, experimenttracking, pipeline-automatisering.
Begrip van CI/CD, containerisatie (Docker), en infrastructure-as-code (ARM, Bicep of Terraform).
Vaardigheid in het analyseren van modelprestaties en het doorvoeren van verbeteringen.
Sterk analytisch denkvermogen en probleemoplossend vermogen.




Wat bieden wij?

Uitgebreide opleidingsmogelijkheden door ervaren professionals.
Snelle groei binnen een expert-driven omgeving.
Een hecht team met regelmatige kennisdelingssessies en events.
Dynamische bedrijfscultuur: geniet van leuke evenementen zoals een familiedag, jaarlijkse skitrip, sportevents en game nights.
We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.




Interesse?

Klinkt dit als jouw volgende uitdaging? Stuur dan je cv naar careers@laco.be of solliciteer via onze website Working at LACO | LACO.

HTML:
LACO is een toonaangevend data-intelligentiebedrijf met meer dan 35 jaar expertise in data engineering, analytics en AI. Wij helpen organisaties bij het omzetten van data in waardevolle inzichten en ondersteunen hen in hun digitale transformatie.


Wat ga je doen?

Als AI-Engineer ben jij de technische spil in het ontwikkelen en implementeren van AI-oplossingen op het Azure-platform. Je werkt nauw samen met data scientists, data engineers en softwareontwikkelaars om schaalbare en betrouwbare AI-modellen te bouwen, finetunen en integreren in de productie omgeving.


Je bent verantwoordelijk voor:

  • Het deployen van machine learning modellen via Azure Machine Learning.
  • Het ontwikkelen van pipelines voor data-inname, modeltraining en deployment (CI/CD).
  • Het monitoren, bijsturen en onderhouden van AI-oplossingen in productie.
  • Het toepassen van responsible AI-principes zoals fairness, explainability en privacy.
  • Samenwerken met stakeholders om AI-mogelijkheden om te zetten in waardevolle toepassingen.


Wat neem je mee?

🎓 Vereiste vaardigheden en ervaring:

  • Bachelor of Master in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science of vergelijkbaar.
  • Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als AI-engineer of ML engineer.
  • Ervaring met Python en ML-frameworks zoals scikit-learn, TensorFlow of PyTorch.

Aantoonbare ervaring met Microsoft Azure, met name:

  • Azure Machine Learning (AML)
  • Azure Data Lake / Data Factory
  • Azure Cognitive Services
  • Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions
  • Azure Kubernetes Services (AKS) voor modeldeployment (pré)
  • Ervaring met MLOps-praktijken: versiebeheer, experimenttracking, pipeline-automatisering.
  • Begrip van CI/CD, containerisatie (Docker), en infrastructure-as-code (ARM, Bicep of Terraform).
  • Vaardigheid in het analyseren van modelprestaties en het doorvoeren van verbeteringen.
  • Sterk analytisch denkvermogen en probleemoplossend vermogen.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Uitgebreide opleidingsmogelijkheden door ervaren professionals.
  • Snelle groei binnen een expert-driven omgeving.
  • Een hecht team met regelmatige kennisdelingssessies en events.
  • Dynamische bedrijfscultuur: geniet van leuke evenementen zoals een familiedag, jaarlijkse skitrip, sportevents en game nights.
  • We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.

Title: R&D Data Science internship
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Are you passionate about the science behind products? Do you want to develop innovations for the world's biggest brands? Then a technical career at P&G could be what you are looking for!

Join us for an internship and you could soon leave your mark in fields like natural sciences, materials, automation, sustainability, analytics, simulation and modelling through your project.

We are looking for R&D Data Science intern who will help Fabric & Home Care by leveraging data-driven insights through machine learning and deep learning techniques, including convolutional neural networks, to enhance product and packaging performance and innovate solutions that meet consumer needs. In this role, you will analyze consumer data and develop predictive models all while collaborating with a dynamic team.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G’S SUCCESS:


You will get a chance to gain industrial experience and experience what working with us is like;
You will be responsible for your own project(s) from day 1 and put your technical skills to work on some of the toughest technical challenges;
You will improve your collaboration and management skills through practical experience and interactive training courses;
You get to experience the working environment in a leading international company and learn to work effectively with people of different nationalities and cultural backgrounds.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


Masters students in Software engineering, Data science, Data engineering, instead of just Software Engineering.
Students who will be enrolled at university for the full period of the internship
Demonstrated history of academic excellence at all stages through school and university education
Good command of English
Passion and ability to take initiative and make things happen
Be technically curious, creative and innovative
Have a good communication and collaboration skills
If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.


YOUR ADVANTAGES:


A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours;
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: AI /NLP/ ML Expert
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an AI /NLP/ ML Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either on the company's premises or on site at the customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Architect, design, and implement advanced machine learning models, including but not limited to deep learning, reinforcement learning, and large language models (LLMs);
  • Collaborate with data scientists to refine data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model training pipelines;
  • Deploy machine learning models and AI solutions into production environments, ensuringscalability, performance, and reliability;
  • Integrate AI models with existing systems and workflows, providing seamless functionalityacross platforms;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements andtranslate them into technical solutions;
  • Conduct rigorous testing and validation of AI models, including A/B testing, cross validation, and error analysis


Requirements

  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Proven experience in designing, implementing, and deploying advanced machine learning models and AI systems;
  • Strong experience with large language models (LLMs) and natural language processing (NLP) techniques;
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure);
  • Experience with data processing and ETL tools;
  • Deep understanding of machine learning frameworks and libraries;
  • Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools;
  • Excellent command of the English language


Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting and dynamic company, where you will offer your services as part of a team of a major European Institution, operating in an international, multilingual and multicultural environment where you can expect real chances to make a difference, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (17576/09/2024).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Hong-Kong, Valetta, etc). The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using state-of-the-art technology. The group generates annual revenues in the range of EURO 40 million, with an EBITDA in the range of 20%. The value of our contract portfolio exceeds EURO 250 million. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to government institutions, multinational corporations, public administrations and multinational companies, research and academic institutes.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.




Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:

You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals




Main Qualifications

Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing




Top reasons to work with us:

Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (AI/ML Focus)
Description:
Description

We're a global IT consulting company and a software development service provider that helps organizations operate at their best. With 30+ years of experience, +6 Global locations, and +1000 employees, TEAM combines technology expertise, valuable insights, business intelligence, and a client-centered approach to address challenges in business operations, digital transformation, risk management, compliance, business continuity, and more.




The client is implementing a new system for anti-money laundering in 30 of their subsidiaries around the world.

The technical part of the project involves assessment of the source data in each country and statistical modelling to set up the new system: segmentation of customers and parametrization of detection scenarios.




Profile requirements:

At least a bachelor's degree in data science or a similar field
At least 12 years of experience with development of machine learning or AI models
Good understanding of machine learning algorithms for classification and clustering
Experience with analysis or processing of financial transactions
Python, Spark and Git
Outstanding English both verbal and written
Experience in the field of anti-financial crime or banking is a plus




Desired Skills

Git

Pyspark

Python




What We Offer

Being a part of TEAM International gives you the chance to work on challenging projects with great professionals, international clients, and the latest technologies.

Flexible engagement models.
Work alongside top IT global talent.
Full compliance with security and regulatory standards.
Customized IT and software development solutions.
A supportive and collaborative work environment.

Title: Data Scientist Senior (Freelance)
Description:
Service description:




To accomplish the latter mission, the GD/PSP team performs simulations of the grid behavior which must be analyzed to determine the type of contract (permanent/flexible) that can be offered to the grid user. Approximated results of this analysis are published on the Elia-website, using a tool named the Hosting Capacity Map. The tool indicates the remaining available (permanent/flexible) capacities for new connection requests. The tool must account for any existing capacities, as well as “additional capacities” which consist of reserved & allocated capacities, and residential growth.




We are hiring a highly organized and detail oriented senior data scientist to support the industrialization of existing scripts, as well as the inclusion of new functionalities & a full migration to Python. The ideal candidate would be responsible for the full development process, including efficient programming, discussing functionalities with business experts, maintaining code & user documentation, all while ensuring a timely completion of the deliverables.

First-generation Python scripts have been created to compute the modifications that need to be made to the grid model, so that these “additional capacities” are accounted for. A set of hypotheses is used to determine how these capacities must be accounted for. The script can currently only be used in combination with the grid computation tool DigSilent PowerFactory.

To support the industrialization of the existing scripts, as well as the inclusion of new functionalities & a full migration to Python, we are looking for a senior data scientist with experience in advanced analytics

The main tasks expected are:

Development of an industrialized full-Python tool from requirements & first-generation script.
A refactoring of the scripts to distinguish the parts that must run within DigSilent PowerFactory or not.
Efficient programming to improve readability & performance, while coping with vast amounts of data.
Modular programming to anticipate future functionalities.
The inclusion of completeness verifications for input data.
The development of additional functionalities in close collaboration with the business experts, to limit manual pre-processing of the input data.
The creation of clear & maintainable documentation for the developed tool.

The following competencies are required for this position:

Python programming language experience
Efficient programming, to cope with vast amounts of data
Modular programming, adaptable to changing needs
Profiling and optimization of scripts
Code documentation

Requirements:

At least 5 years’ experience in Python programming
Fluency in English (spoken & written) as well as Dutch and/or French
Basic knowledge of electricity or electric power systems (grid structure, localization of electrical generation and consumption, etc.) is a plus.
Ability to handle vast amounts of data in an efficient manner
Well-organized and attention to details,
Fluent communication and coordination,
Autonomous and capable to manage & respect deadlines,
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills: ability to analyze, interpret and utilize data effectively for their desired purposes.

Additional information:

Location: 1000 Bxl
Work regime: Depending on the stage of the process can vary between 2 or 5 days a week
Start date: 16/06/2025
End date: 31/12/2025
