We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Hybrid working

It’s hugely important for us to share knowledge and build strong relationships with each other, and we find it easier to do this if we spend time together in person. This is why we follow a hybrid model, and would require you to be able to come into the office 3 days a week (currently Tuesday, Wednesday, and one other day depending on which team you’re in). If you have additional needs that would prevent you from following this hybrid approach, we’d be happy to talk through these if you’re selected for an initial screening call.

Please note that when you submit an application, your data will be processed in line with our privacy policy.

>> Click to view other open roles at Isomorphic Labs

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
At Pixel Plus, we are pioneering AI-driven solutions, combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies to build scalable, cutting-edge AI platforms tailored to our clients' needs. Our AI-powered platform enables rapid development and deployment of AI applications.




We are now looking for an AI Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of AI in our projects.




🚀 Join us and drive innovation at the intersection of proprietary and open-source AI!


Tasks



Design, develop, and optimize AI models by combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies, LLMs, and machine learning services.


Enhance and scale our AI Platform, integrating RAG, LLMs, and ML pipelines into real-world applications.


Develop AI agents leveraging Azure AI Foundry and open-source frameworks, enabling a ChatGPT-like experience tailored to different industries.


Work closely with engineering teams to implement best practices in AI deployment, security, and performance.


Collaborate with clients to understand business needs and transform them into scalable AI-driven solutions.


Ensure seamless integration with Azure services and open-source tools, including Cognitive Services, OpenAI models, and vector databases.



Requirements



Proven experience working with Azure AI Foundry and open-source AI ecosystems.


Strong background in LLM fine-tuning, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and AI-driven application development.


Proficiency in Python, ML frameworks, and cloud-native AI solutions.


Hands-on experience with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI APIs, and vector search.


Experience in AI security, MLOps, and deploying scalable AI solutions.


Ability to troubleshoot and optimize AI models for performance and accuracy.


Fluent in English (German is a plus).



Benefits



Exciting AI-driven projects with a strong focus on innovation.


Flexible work environment (remote or hybrid options).


Opportunity to lead AI initiatives in a fast-growing company.


Competitive salary & benefits.


Collaboration with AI & cloud experts shaping the future of AI.





Pixel Plus is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Lausanne)
Description:
Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Type: Permanent contract

Location: Switzerland (Lausanne or Zurich)

About Us

At Visium, we enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, executing large scale transformations and implementing AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof.

With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, we empower our clients to unleash and scale the power of their data.

We're on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations. Join the curious, the ambitious, the doers, the good-hearted, the ones who build a world we're all in awe of - our Visumees.

Ready to become one?

Role

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will assume a technical leadership role in designing, implementing and deploying innovative solutions with tangible business impact. Join our growing team and contribute to our expansion in Switzerland and internationally

Coupling state-of-the-art Machine Learning techniques with best practices in Software Engineering you will build robust and scalable applications that empower our clients to drive meaningful value from their data. You are passionate about understanding client needs to drive top-notch customer experience and adoption. Finally, you are meticulously organized and prepared to work in a fast-paced and dynamic team environment.

Requirements

Embark on a rewarding journey where you


Proactively take ownership of projects, making decisions and ensuring successful outcomes
Embrace challenges as opportunities to learn, actively seeking and sharing feedback to expand your skills
Exhibit genuine empathy, understanding diverse perspectives and fostering a collaborative and team-oriented atmosphere
Have strong communication skills and the ability to present insights to non-technical and technical stakeholders in an accessible way


In addition, this should be part of your background to apply


4+ years of professional experience as a Machine Learning or Data Scientist or in a relevant role
Experience with ML/DL frameworks and tools in Python (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, huggingface/transformers)
Proficiency in Software Development best practices (e.g., Object-Oriented Programming, Design Patterns, Agile Methodology)
Experience in applying deep learning approaches, such as recurrent and convolutional neural networks and transformer models
Experience with MLOps best practices and tools (e.g., dvc, MLFlow, tfX, Kubeflow)
Experience developing and deploying ML solutions using Cloud services (e.g., AWS Sagemaker, GCP Vertex.AI, Azure ML)
Familiarity with REST API and microservices


The following are a plus


Experience with Data and AI platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, Snowflake) or an associated Data Engineer certification
Experience working in a client-facing or consulting role
Familiarity with Generative AI models & tools (e.g., langchain, OpenAI API, LLama2)
Familiarity with web development (e.g., Next.js, React, FastAPI, Flask)



Benefits

What we offer


A competitive compensation package
A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve
A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind
A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us
A position that enables you to have an impact on 1'000s of people, and the whole company's growth
An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset


Check our LinkedIn and website to learn more about us & don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.
Show more

Title: Research Scientist, Paradigms of Intelligence
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


PhD degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
One or more scientific publication submissions for conferences, journals, or public repositories.


Preferred qualifications:


Post-doctoral experience.
Experience with first-authored publications in conferences or journals in physics (e.g., Physical Review Letters), programming languages (e.g., PLDI, ICFP), combinatorial optimization, or especially machine learning (e.g., ICLR, ICML, NeurIPS).
Experience with Machine Learning.
Excellent computer programming skills.
Demonstrated expertise relevant to our mission: programming languages theory (e.g., rewriting systems, type systems, functional programming) or physics of complex systems.


About the jobAs an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.

As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.

To advance the field of artificial intelligence by exploring alternative computational paradigms beyond those currently trending. We aim to deepen our understanding of how complexity emerges in differentiable/non-differentiable automated algorithm discovery methods. We are interested in the design of systems that, starting from a problem description, are capable of producing algorithmic solutions that exhibit compositionality, hierarchical structures, and component reuse.

Responsibilities


Carry out sustained exploratory research.
Review literature, identify key questions, design experiments, and interpret results.
Collaborate in person and remotely; maintain a respectful work environment.
Share ideas verbally and in writing; publish and present work at journals and/or scientific conferences.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Show more

Title: Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science)
Description:
CT_Technology & Innovation-E122

Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science) - Full Time - Oberwinterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

We are looking for an R&D Engineer, Data Science Intern to join our Chemtech, Technology and Innovation, team in Oberwinterthur.

Join our R&D team for six months and develop innovative solutions for the chemical industry and sustainable technologies, including carbon capture and emission control. Focused on digitalization, you will help drive data-driven product development from ideation to market-ready solutions within our Separation Technology business unit.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


Collaborate in Contribute to data-driven product development within the Separation Technology business unit.
Collect, organize, and analyze experimental data from our pilot plants and production facilities.
Identify opportunities to enhance our experimental design and critical parameters for product optimization.
Play an active role in implementing new analytical technologies to support digital transformation.


To succeed in this role, you will need:


Student or recent graduate in Chemical, Process, or Mechanical Engineering (related disciplines welcome).
Experience in data evaluation, modeling, visualization, and data-driven analysis.
Previous experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office is expected.
Curious, motivated team player with a knack for problem-solving and a desire to advance your career in a dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment.
Fluency in English.


What we offer you:


25 days holiday (exclusive of bank holidays)
Defined contribution pension scheme
Employee Assistance Program/health care
On-site car parking/public transport allowance
Access to a wide range of discounts


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.

Do you have a question about the role?

Reach out to Alexi Donadoni at Alexi.Donadoni@sulzer.com . Our team is looking forward hearing from you!

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2025 in Brazil, China, Finland, Germany, Ireland, Switzerland, South Africa, the UK and the USA.

Title: Data Scientist 80-100%
Description:
Für unser Team Customer Analytics im Geschäftsbereich Club suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung am Standort Ostermundigen BE eine dynamische, engagierte und zielorientierte Persönlichkeit als Data Scientist.




Das können Sie bewegen

Extraktion, Analyse und Modellierung von Daten zur Unterstützung von Produktmanagement, Customer Experience, Marketing und Kampagnenmanagement
Erstellung, Validierung und laufende Optimierung von Affinity-Scores
Entwicklung von Predictive Models mit Hilfe moderner Machine-Learning-Methoden
Pflege und Weiterentwicklung von Datenpipelines und ETL-Prozessen
Visualisierung und Kommunikation komplexer Zusammenhänge mittels BI-Tools und zielgruppengerechtem Storytelling
Interpretation der Resultate und Ableitung datenbasierter Empfehlungen für Entscheidungsprozesse
Mitarbeit in bereichsübergreifenden Projekten, insbesondere bei der Integration neuer Datenquellen und Modellentwicklung




Damit gelingt Ihnen der Einstieg

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in Data Analytics und Machine Learning (z. B. Klassifikation, Regression, Clustering)
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie Erfahrung mit Python
Erfahrung mit Statistik- und Analyseplattformen wie SAS Viya, Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools
Verständnis für Datenmodellierung, Feature Engineering und Modellbewertung
Fähigkeit, komplexe Datenanalysen verständlich und zielgerichtet zu präsentieren
Hohe Kundenorientierung, Eigenverantwortung und Freude an interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit
Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse, gute Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil




Darauf können Sie sich freuen

Zentraler Arbeitsort mit guter ÖV-Anbindung
Moderner Arbeitsplatz
Internes Präventions- und Fitnessprogramm (Yoga, Pilates etc.)
Ein angenehmes und offenes Arbeitsklima sowie zeitgemässe Anstellungsbedingungen




Interessiert? Dann bewerben Sie sich noch heute und schreiben Sie mit uns TCS-Geschichte.




Beim TCS schätzen und respektieren wir vielfältige Lebenswege und die Diversität der Profile unserer Mitarbeitenden. Gleichbehandlung hat für uns oberste Priorität.




Francine Hänni, HR Business Partner, gibt Ihnen unter +41 58 827 30 05 gerne Auskunft zur Stelle.




Deshalb gibt es uns seit über 125 Jahren: Rund um den TCS Schweiz - TCS Schweiz




Touring Club Schweiz

Human Resources

Francine Hänni

3072 Ostermundigen

Title: MLOps Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
Who we are

At viboo, we’re pioneering the way to operate commercial buildings. Since buildings are one of the largest sources of carbon emissions globally, we made it our mission to reduce their environmental impact. Our easy-to-retrofit, cloud and AI-native Building Management Systems (BMS) minimizes heating energy consumption while helping owners cut operational costs and enhance occupant comfort.

We're looking for an ML/MLOps Engineer to join our purpose-driven ETH spin-off—either immediately or by mutual agreement. In this role, your expertise in deploying, operating, and maintaining machine learning services will be instrumental in making our vision becoming reality.




About the job

As an ML/MLOps Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Designing, building, and maintaining end-to-end ML-pipelines using Kubeflow, ensuring scalability and robustness.
Implementing advanced testing strategies for ML-pipelines – such as simulation-based testing – to support continuous integration and ensure reliability.
Develop and maintain reliable deployment strategies for ML-pipelines and models (e.g. canary deployment).
Ensure consistent and reliable model operation across a variety of execution modes: scheduled jobs, integration within constrained optimization frameworks (Model Predictive Control), or real-time inference.
Implement and manage monitoring solutions to detect model drift, control performance drops, etc. using Grafana and Prometheus.
Orchestrate and manage containerized ML workloads using Kubernetes and Kubeflow on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Conducting peer reviews of code written by other developers, debugging issues, and optimizing overall platform performance.




What you offer

Background in Computer Science, Data Science, or related technical field.
5+ years of professional experience in MLOps, with a strong track record of delivering production-grade solutions.
Proven expertise in deploying and managing machine learning workloads using Kubernetes and Kubeflow. 
Hands-on experience in developing time series ML models, including feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and model evaluation in Python.
Experience working with public cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is an advantage.
Familiarity with monitoring and alerting tools. Grafana and Prometheus is beneficial.  
Experience with PostgreSQL or similar relational databases is considered a plus. 
Independent work style, hands-on mentality, and strong teamwork skills.
Fluent in English (at least C1 level) and excellent communication skills in general.




What we offer

An international, smart, and enthusiastic team with a clear vision.
A meaningful job in a DeepTech startup committed to sustainability.
Exciting insights into the rapidly growing and emerging AI industry.
Short decision paths, flat hierarchies, and the opportunity to shape the company.
Competitive salary package, including an employee stock option plan (ESOP).
Hybrid/remote work options and flexible working hours.
A steep learning curve to accelerate your career and individual training opportunities.
Regular team events.




Interested? Please send an email with your motivation and CV to benjamin.huber@viboo.io

Show more

  • Ensure consistent and reliable model operation across a variety of execution modes: scheduled jobs, integration within constrained optimization frameworks (Model Predictive Control), or real-time inference.
  • Implement and manage monitoring solutions to detect model drift, control performance drops, etc. using Grafana and Prometheus.
  • Orchestrate and manage containerized ML workloads using Kubernetes and Kubeflow on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • Conducting peer reviews of code written by other developers, debugging issues, and optimizing overall platform performance.


What you offer

  • Background in Computer Science, Data Science, or related technical field.
  • 5+ years of professional experience in MLOps, with a strong track record of delivering production-grade solutions.
  • Proven expertise in deploying and managing machine learning workloads using Kubernetes and Kubeflow. 
  • Hands-on experience in developing time series ML models, including feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and model evaluation in Python.
  • Experience working with public cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is an advantage.
  • Familiarity with monitoring and alerting tools. Grafana and Prometheus is beneficial.  
  • Experience with PostgreSQL or similar relational databases is considered a plus. 
  • Independent work style, hands-on mentality, and strong teamwork skills.
  • Fluent in English (at least C1 level) and excellent communication skills in general.


What we offer

  • An international, smart, and enthusiastic team with a clear vision.
  • A meaningful job in a DeepTech startup committed to sustainability.
  • Exciting insights into the rapidly growing and emerging AI industry.
  • Short decision paths, flat hierarchies, and the opportunity to shape the company.
  • Competitive salary package, including an employee stock option plan (ESOP).
  • Hybrid/remote work options and flexible working hours.
  • A steep learning curve to accelerate your career and individual training opportunities.
  • Regular team events.


Interested? Please send an email with your motivation and CV to benjamin.huber@viboo.io

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being: Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth, Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace, Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays
Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth: Development Dollars, Leadership development, Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings
Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
5 weeks paid vacation
Social events & Thursday happy hours
Free lunch 2 days per week
Pension plan contributions
Supplemental accident insurance
Health insurance subsidy of 250 CHF per month
Lunch Check Card of 180 CHF per month
Profawo membership which is a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the compatibility of family and work



Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: Fellow: Software Engineer (Machine Learning)
Description:
Organizational Context




This Fellowship is in the Advanced Technology Applications Center (ATAC) of the Global Databases Division, Infrastructure & Platforms Sector of WIPO. The Section is responsible for providing support in AI and machine learning (ML) applications to other WIPO sections and other external entities. The Section has developed its own AI tools for WIPO, Intellectual Property offices in the countries and for other international organizations: automatic translation tool (WIPO Translate, http://patentscope.wipo.int/translate), image classification and similarity for trademarks and industrial designs (https://branddb.wipo.int/). The section has also developed WIPO speech- to-text (voice recognition for conferences, available at webcast.wipo.int) for the needs of the over 150 meetings that WIPO hosts every year. ATAC wishes to continue exploring the applicability of AI/ML to other intellectual property activities.




We are looking for a fellow to contribute to maintain and further develop WIPO speech-to-text (S2T) and participate in the exploration of new tools like Large Language Models to create downstream applications. The selected fellow will also contribute to the further development of near real time S2T (WIPO Live S2T).




This fellowship provides an opportunity for a young professional to gain knowledge and experience in full lifecycle development of AI/ML models, applications, from data collection, to preparation, training, evaluation, and deployment to production. The post is located at WIPO’s headquarters in Geneva.




The fellow works under the supervision of a Machine Learning Researcher of ATAC.







Duties and Responsibilities




The fellow will perform the following principal duties:




(a) Contribute to the continued development of WIPO Live S2T in the end-to-end paradigm. This includes improving the speed and accuracy of the existing tool.




(b) Contribute to further develop existing WIPO S2T. This includes adding new features using state of the art AI/ML algorithms and models.




(c) Take an active role in daily operations of WIPO S2T and WIPO Live S2T. This includes deploying new instances, monitoring running instances, troubleshooting, and other related activities.




(d) Contribute to WIPO S2T adjacent projects such as speech translation, full text search, summarization, text-to-speech, etc.




(e) Refine the existing training datasets by performing quantitative and qualitative analysis. This also includes the refinement of the data preparation pipelines.




(f) Gather and clean training data, and process it in a format that can successfully be used by our tool. Advise the team on ways to enrich our data resources and explore the usage of external resources.




(g) Contribute to the evaluation of speech-to-text tools and isolate test and development data to carefully evaluate the quality of the trained models using automatic metrics.




(h) Research new technologies in AI/machine learning, evaluate their potential, and contribute to advising the ATAC team on possible new application ideas for WIPO’s Global Database Division.




(i) Perform other related tasks as required.







Requirements




Education - Essential

Advanced university degree (MSc) in computer science in the fields of S2T, Natural Language Processing (NLP), AI/ML, or related fields.




Education - Desirable

PhD in computer science in the fields of S2T, NLP, AI/ML, or related fields.




Experience - Essential

Proven software engineering skills, with a focus on collaborative development, code quality, comprehensive documentation and adherence to best software development practices.
At least two years of experience in the field of AI/ML, relevant R&D projects or PhD.




Experience - Desirable

Two years of experience in S2T.
Experience in NLP
Experience with devOps in server environments.




Language - Essential

Excellent (written and spoken) knowledge of English or excellent (written and spoken) knowledge of French and good knowledge of English.




Language - Desirable

Knowledge of any other UN languages will be considered an advantage.




Job-related Competencies - Essential

Proven extensive knowledge of deep learning architectures focused on speech processing, such as RNN and transformer.
Strong software development skills with a focus on collaborative development, code quality, comprehensive documentation and adherence to best software development practices.
Proficiency in Python, bash and/or Java.
Good level of familiarity with Unix/Linux environments.
Self-driven candidate with critical thinking and strong problem-solving skills..
Ability to work independently as well as being part of the team, persistence when facing difficult or technically new challenges.




Job-related Competencies - Desirable

Machine learning techniques such as neural network training, hyperparameter tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, LORA, ablation studies etc.
Neural networks frameworks and APIs: Pytorch, TensorFlow, FastAI, Huggingface.
Experience with S2T toolkits like: Kaldi, ESPNet, wav2vec.
Internet technologies including Lucene (ElasticSearch / Solr), Angular.js, JavaScript, Tomcat, as well as UI design, CSS, HTML, and related technologies.
Experience with LLMs would be a plus.
DevOps: version control systems (SVN, GIT), containerization (Docker) and cloud servers.
Excellent writing skills for technical documentation, administration guides and user guides in English
Scientific publications or significant contributions to open-source projects will be an advantage.
Knowledge of IP information tools, products, and standards.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and ability to maintain effective partnerships and working relations in a multicultural environment with sensitivity and respect for diversity.







Terms and Conditions




a) Term of fellowship: A fellowship may be granted for a period of up to 12 months with the possibility to renew.




b) Anticipated Start Date: June 15, 2025.




c) Location: WIPO Headquarters, Geneva, Switzerland.




d) Stipend is set in accordance with the level of qualifications and experience of the Fellow (stipend starts from 6,000 CHF monthly and may vary up to maximum 7,000 CHF monthly). Details are available on request.




e) Travel expenses: WIPO shall contribute towards the cost of the fellow’s travel on engagement and separation from service. If necessary, WIPO may aid in obtaining an entry visa to Switzerland. (If applicable)




f) WIPO contributes towards the medical insurance and provides accident insurance coverage during the fellowship.




g) WIPO will request a “carte de légitimation” for the Fellow, which serves as a residence and work permit, from the Permanent Mission of Switzerland to the United Nations Office and to the other international organizations in Geneva. Family members of the Fellow are not eligible for a “carte de legitimation.” (if applicable)




h) Tax and social security: Fellows shall be solely responsible for meeting any taxation and social security obligations that may arise directly or indirectly from their contract with WIPO. (If applicable)




i) Fellows are not staff members of WIPO and the position does not lead to any employment rights and entitlements beyond the terms of the fellowship.







Application Process




All interested candidates should apply through LinkedIn. Since LinkedIn only allows one document upload under 'Resume', ensure your Curriculum Vitae and Motivation Letter are combined into a single file before submitting.




The application deadline is May 15, 2025.




More information about the activities of the Advanced Technology Applications Center (ATAC) is available at https://www.wipo.int/about-ip/en/artificial_intelligence/ip_administration.html.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Senior Data Scientist to join our Data & Analytics team based in Stabio, Switzerland.

Let’s talk about the role!

This is a brilliant role that combines data science, with a strong focus on generative AI, and advanced forecasting. This role will involve developing and implementing advanced AI models to drive cutting edge innovation across the value chain, from Design to Planning. Working side-by-side with the business, the resource will drive AI transformation in the business and regional commercial community


Develop and deploy generative AI models to support merchandising lifecycle
Develop next gen forecasting models to fuel our regional trading activities
Optimize and fine-tune AI models for performance, scalability, and accuracy.
Present findings and recommendations to senior business stakeholders in the regions. Embed capability and create AI trust in the business community
Play as a organizational change agents, to support AI and Gen.AI transformation in the organization.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, and apply them to enhance our fashion products and services


Skills For Success


A high level of education or qualifications in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or Engineering
Previous experience in data science, with a focus on newest generative AI technology
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Experience with AI frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Strong understanding of deep learning, neural networks and GAN (general adversarial network)
Proven track record of developing and deploying AI models in a production environment.
Digital native, with Passion for fashion and a keen eye for Gen.AI trends.
Retail/Fashion background will be considered a plus


VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It’s the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling.

Learn more at vfc.com

What’s In It For You

We’re in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we’re the total package.


A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks


This post is not eligible for relocation support.

Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

Title: AI/LLM Engineer
Description:
Our client, a ML Focused consultancy are looking for a German-speaking AI Engineering Consultant to join a fast-growing team in Basel and drive impactful AI transformations! (They also have a several ongoing projects in Zurich)🔥

💡 Why this role?
You’ll be at the forefront of AI & ML adoption, helping organizations design, build & scale ML solutions beyond prototypes. You won’t just write code—you’ll shape AI strategy, implement best practices, and enable teams to unlock the full potential of AI.

🌍 Your impact:
✅ Consult & Engineer: Work with cutting-edge ML, LLMs & Generative AI technologies to solve real-world challenges.
✅ End-to-End AI Operations: Design & optimize data, model & code pipelines (DataOps, MLOps & DevOps).
✅ Technical Leadership: Be a trusted advisor, shape solution blueprints, and drive AI engineering excellence.
✅ Collaboration & Enablement: Work closely with teams to operationalize AI & ensure reliability, scalability, and automation.

🔍 What you bring:
🔹 3+ years of experience in ML, AI, or Software Engineering
🔹 Hands-on expertise in ML models, LLMs, and Data/AI platforms (Snowflake, Databricks, etc.)
🔹 Strong understanding of DataOps, DevOps, and MLOps best practices
🔹 Passion for scaling AI beyond POCs & driving enterprise AI success

Our client, a ML Focused consultancy are looking for a German-speaking AI Engineering Consultant to join a fast-growing team in Basel and drive impactful AI transformations! (They also have a several ongoing projects in Zurich)🔥

💡 Why this role?
You’ll be at the forefront of AI & ML adoption, helping organizations design, build & scale ML solutions beyond prototypes. You won’t just write code—you’ll shape AI strategy, implement best practices, and enable teams to unlock the full potential of AI.

🌍 Your impact:
✅ Consult & Engineer: Work with cutting-edge ML, LLMs & Generative AI technologies to solve real-world challenges.
✅ End-to-End AI Operations: Design & optimize data, model & code pipelines (DataOps, MLOps & DevOps).
✅ Technical Leadership: Be a trusted advisor, shape solution blueprints, and drive AI engineering excellence.
✅ Collaboration & Enablement: Work closely with teams to operationalize AI & ensure reliability, scalability, and automation.

🔍 What you bring:
🔹 3+ years of experience in ML, AI, or Software Engineering
🔹 Hands-on expertise in ML models, LLMs, and Data/AI platforms (Snowflake, Databricks, etc.)
🔹 Strong understanding of DataOps, DevOps, and MLOps best practices
🔹 Passion for scaling AI beyond POCs & driving enterprise AI success

Title: Senior ML Engineer (Zürich)
Description:
You want to operate at the cutting edge of AI, building the strongest defenses in the AI cybersecurity market. You will be increasing the scope and quality of our defenses, and playing a pivotal role in ensuring that GenAI applications can be deployed securely at scale. You will lead the creation of cutting-edge models that perform exceptionally well and operate in real time. This involves continuously identifying edge cases for our detectors and working to collect and generate intricate threat datasets to improve the performance of these models. You will ensure that Lakera can continuously ship the best defenses in the market with a high cadence. Your passion lies in shaping the future, working on ideas that define the secure use of AI in the decades ahead. Your work will play a vital role in ensuring that AI can unleash its best potential–for good.

About Lakera

Lakera is on a mission to ensure AI does what we want it to do. We are heading towards a future where AI agents run our businesses and personal lives. Here at Lakera, we're not just dreaming about the future; we're building the security foundation for it. We empower security teams and builders so that their businesses can adopt AI technologies and unleash the next phase of intelligent computing.

We work with Fortune 500 companies, startups, and foundation model providers to protect them and their users from adversarial misalignment. We are also the company behind Gandalf, the world’s most popular AI security game.

Lakera has offices in San Francisco and Zurich.

We move fast and work with intensity. We act as one team but expect everyone to take substantial ownership and accountability. We prioritize transparency at every level and are committed to always raising the bar in everything we do. We promote diversity of thought as we believe that creates the best outcomes.

Example projects


Extend the scope of one of our detectors to support multiple languages without dropping performance on already supported languages.
Increase the scope where our defenses perform by 100x (e.g., multi-lingual data, code, etc).
Extend modeling and data generation to enable passing additional context to our prompt injection detectors, such as the LLM output and behavioral metadata.
Red team our model to understand the most pressing vulnerabilities of our detectors and prioritize the data collection and generation required to fix them.


What You’ll Bring


You have at least 4 years of experience shipping machine learning models to production, ideally in environments where reliability and quality are key (e.g., autonomous driving, industrial applications, healthcare).
Most of your experience productionizing ML models has been in unstructured data spaces such as NLP and vision.
You have had experience working on end-to-end development of ML models.
You have experience working on the “long tail” of data distribution, bringing models from prototypes to real-world systems.
You aspire to play a pivotal role in defining the future of secure AI within a mission-driven company with ambitious goals.


👉 Let's stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter & Instagram to learn more about what is happening at Lakera.

ℹ️ Join us on Momentum, the slack community for AI Safety and Security everything.

❗To remove your information from our recruitment database, please email privacy@lakera.ai.

Title: MLOps Engineer (80-100%)
Description:
Oops! Unser MLOps braucht Verstärkung.



Die SVA Zürich betreut Hunderttausende von Kundinnen und Kunden – und es werden immer mehr. Um den steigenden Erwartungen an Effizienz und Servicequalität gerecht zu werden, entwickeln wir unser Unternehmen kontinuierlich weiter. Eine zentrale Rolle spielen dabei die Automatisierung und die intelligente Verarbeitung der rasant wachsenden Datenmengen. Mittendrin: Sie als unsere neue Fachperson MLOps.



Wir haben spannende Projekte in der Datenpipeline.



Bei Der SVA Zürich Gibt Es Im Bereich Daten Und KI Noch Viel Zu Tun. Eine Kompetente Und Initiative Persönlichkeit Wie Sie Hat Darum Viel Gestaltungsspielraum. Einige Beispiele




Sie implementieren Best Practices für CI/CD von ML-Modellen (Versionskontrolle, Containerisierung, automatisiertes Testing, Deployment).
Sie entwickeln und optimieren ETL/ELT-Pipelines zur Integration verschiedener Datenquellen ins zentrale Data Warehouse (Exasol).
In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Data Scientists und Data Engineers aus der Unternehmensentwicklung stellen Sie Daten für Modelle und Analysen bereit.
Mit internen und externen Partnern konzipieren und optimieren Sie unsere IT-Infrastruktur (Cloud/On-Premise, Skalierung, Sicherheit).




Ihre Parameter überzeugen uns.



Sie verfügen über




ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in einem technischen oder mathematischen Fach
Programmiererfahrung in Python, Java oder Scala – insbesondere im Zusammenhang mit Datenpipelines und der Verarbeitung unstrukturierter Daten
fundierte SQL-Kenntnisse und praktische Erfahrung mit Data-Warehouse-Technologien
Erfahrung mit modernen DevOps-/MLOps-Werkzeugen sowie mit Cloud-Plattformen wie z.B. Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow, MLflow.




Wenn Sie ausserdem mit Datenschutz und Datensicherheit vertraut sind – idealerweise im regulierten Umfeld von Sozial- oder Versicherungsinstitutionen –, dann sollten wir uns kennenlernen.





Weitere Auskünfte



Die SVA Zürich ist das Kompetenzzentrum für Sozialversicherungen. Sie gehört zu den Top-Arbeitgebenden im Kanton und liegt in Fussdistanz zum Hauptbahnhof Zürich. Dass unsere mehr als 1000 Mitarbeitenden überdurchschnittlich zufrieden sind, hat gute Gründe: eine Tätigkeit, die Sinn macht, flexible Arbeitszeiten, Homeoffice und gute Sozialleistungen. Möchten Sie sich in einer wertschätzenden und offenen Unternehmenskultur einbringen und weiterentwickeln? Herzlich willkommen bei der SVA Zürich.



Sie kennen die SVA Zürich nicht? Höchste Zeit, uns kennenzulernen: http://www.svazurich.ch/erleben



Unsere HR-Fachfrau, Edith Steuble, 044 448 58 43, gibt Ihnen gerne weitere Auskünfte.
Show more

Title: Computer Vision/Machine Learning Engineer (Spatial AI)
Description:
The Reality Labs team at Meta is looking for Computer Vision Engineers to support our engineering teams as we build towards our goal to transform the way people come together to interact, work and play.We explore, develop and deliver cutting-edge technologies that serve as the foundations for the current and future Reality Labs products including VR, AR, smart-glasses, AI assistants, and robotics. We are committed to driving the state-of-the-art forward through relentless innovation. Through ML perception in 2D and 3D, for both primitives (e.g. depth, segmentation, and semantic keypoints) as well as high-level(e.g. shape inference, 3D reconstruction, context/semantic Understanding), our team is focused on taking new technologies from early incubation to the product level while iterating, prototyping, and realizing the human value and new experiences they open up.Do you have a passion for exploring and solving challenging computer vision and machine learning problems? Do you love solving novel problems from first principles, or delivering SOTA technologies into products used by millions of users? Are you always on the lookout for better, faster, and more efficient solutions? Do you want to help build the core technologies that will enable the new products and experiences?The potential to change the world is immense -- and we're just getting started. We encourage you to apply and join us!

Computer Vision/Machine Learning Engineer (Spatial AI) Responsibilities:


Design and development of novel machine learning algorithms to solve computer vision problems in areas such as: Vision-Language Models, Vision Foundation Models, 3D reconstruction, surface reconstruction, or photorealistic rendering, depth estimation, semantic segmentation, 2D and 3D semantic key point detection, or object tracking.
Drive the team's goals and technical direction and to pursue technical opportunities
Lead and collaborate with multidisciplinary engineering and research teams to develop technologies from early exploration and incubation to production.
Develop prototypes for future VR/AR/MR experiences, drive continued development, and integrate robust solutions into products.
Define projects for other engineers to possibly solve and achieve impact based on your direction.


Minimum Qualifications:


MSc degree in Computer Science, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Robotics or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one or more of the following areas: Deep Learning, Computer Vision, 3D Vision, Robotics, Machine Learning.
Experience developing computer vision algorithms or computer vision infrastructure in C/C++ or Python
Experience in deep learning and PyTorch


Preferred Qualifications:


PhD degree in Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Robotics or related technical field.
Experience with distributed systems or on-device algorithm development
Industry experience working on projects such as: Vision-Language Models, Vision Foundation Models, 3D reconstruction, surface reconstruction, or photorealistic rendering, depth estimation, semantic segmentation, 2D and 3D semantic key point detection, or object tracking.


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
At Akkodis Switzerland, we're looking for a skilled MLOps Engineer to join our team and play a key role in shaping and supporting cutting-edge AI infrastructure. You’ll work across architecture, security, automation, and FinOps—driving smart, reliable solutions from design to deployment.




🚀 What You’ll Be Doing

As a Technical Operations Specialist to support MLOps , you will:

Lead security assessments and ensure policy compliance.
Optimize and monitor cloud infrastructure costs (FinOps).
Support MLOps architecture and contribute to system design and documentation.
Conduct PoCs and evaluate new technologies.
Break down technical tasks and support project planning.




🛠️ What You Bring

Solid experience with cloud platforms (ideally AWS) and cost optimization strategies.
Strong proficiency in Python, plus hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and CI/CD tools like GitLab and ArgoCD.
Familiarity with security concepts (Zero Trust, SAML, OAuth).
Experience with monitoring/observability tools like Grafana, ELK, or Datadog.
Experience with MLOps tools like Kubeflow or KServe is a plus




💡 Why Join Us?

At Akkodis, you'll collaborate with forward-thinking engineers, data scientists, and architects on impactful AI initiatives. We offer a dynamic environment where your ideas matter, and your growth is supported.
Ready to make an impact at the intersection of AI and infrastructure?
Let’s build the future together.

Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer | Zürich | CHF150.000
Description:
Job Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Zürich (80-100%)

Salary: Up to CHF 150.000 per year




Role Overview:

Optimus Search has partnered with a leading software development company based in Zürich. As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for balancing responsibilities between software engineering and machine learning, as well as scaling the company's team size and processing volume.




Responsibilities:

Create and build efficient, maintainable software solutions in Python by applying industry best practices and design patterns, while ensuring high-quality code.
Perform code reviews and offer constructive feedback to maintain the quality and consistency of the codebase.
Connect the business requirements with the technical solution, emphasizing the selection of the most suitable tools for the task.
Design and maintain custom transformer-based NLP architectures.
Stay informed on cutting-edge research, extract valuable insights, and apply them to enhance our models.
Contribute to all stages of the end-to-end prediction service, including data management, model enhancements, monitoring, and scalability.




Requirements:

MSc or PhD in mathematics, physics or computer science.
5+ years professional experience with software development in any object-oriented programming language (C#, C++, Java, Python), as well as experience coding in F#, Haskell and/or Scala.
A strong passion for research, with a theoretical approach to problem solving using category theory.
Solid experience in machine learning processes, ideally within NLP.
Experience with the entire Product Development Life Cycle, from design, implementation, deployment and acting on user feedback.
Structured and self-reliant approach.




Compensation:

Generous salary of up to CHF150.000 depending on experience
Flexible working hours, with the opportunity for substantial hybrid working
The option to have part of your salary paid in shares in the company
Work in a modern, centrally located office in Zürich
The chance for bonuses at the end of the year

Title: Ingénieur(e) Python
Description:
📢 Notre mission

Ivy Partners est une société de conseil suisse qui accompagne les entreprises dans leurs défis stratégiques, technologiques et organisationnels.




Nous avons à cœur d’offrir à nos collaborateurs une carrière qui favorise leur épanouissement personnel et professionnel. Nous les accompagnons dans leur montée en compétences et leur ouvrons de réelles perspectives d’évolution.




👩‍💻🧑‍💻 En tant que Ingénieur(e) Python chez Ivy Partners, vous serez amené(e) à :

Concevoir, construire, exploiter et améliorer continuellement les plateformes d'hébergement.
Assurer la sécurité, la mise à jour et le fonctionnement continu des infrastructures.
Participer aux astreintes en rotation avec les autres membres de l'équipe.
Développer des API internes, des outils et des processus qui améliorent l'efficacité et réduisent les risques opérationnels.
Promouvoir les pratiques de développement logiciel et DevOps.
Enseigner, encadrer, développer et conseiller d'autres experts et équipes dans l'organisation.




🏅 À propos de vous:

Vous avez un minimum de 3 ans d'expérience.
Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme d'ingénieur ou équivalent.
Vous possédez des connaissances approfondies sur des sujets d'architecture tels que l'intégration, la sécurité, le réseau et la gestion des identités et des accès.
Vous maîtrisez les pratiques de l'artisanat logiciel, la programmation et les langages de script (Python, Java, Go, bash, PowerShell, ou équivalents).
Vous avez une solide expérience avec l'intégration continue et la livraison continue.
Vous avez de l'expérience avec les outils de gestion des infrastructures (surveillance et observabilité, journalisation, gestion de configuration, etc.).
Vous êtes un joueur d'équipe avec de fortes compétences en communication et interpersonnelles.
Vous êtes profondément curieux(se) et désireux(se) d'apprendre de nouvelles technologies et compétences.
Vous vous concentrez sur des stratégies proactives pour prévenir les problèmes avant qu'ils ne surviennent.
Vous parlez couramment français et anglais.







🤝 Pourquoi rejoindre Ivy Partners ?




Prendre soin de nos collaborateurs | Nous leur offrons un environnement bienveillant où chacun est valorisé, avec des formations et des opportunités d’évolution en Suisse et à l’international.




Créer un climat de confiance | Travailler avec nous, c’est construire une relation basée sur la transparence, le professionnalisme et l’engagement.




Encourager l’innovation | Nous allions technologie et créativité pour mener à bien des transformations numériques à fort impact.




Assumer nos responsabilités | Le collectif est au cœur de nos actions et nous mettons tout en œuvre pour générer un impact positif.

Show more

  • Assurer la sécurité, la mise à jour et le fonctionnement continu des infrastructures.
  • Participer aux astreintes en rotation avec les autres membres de l'équipe.
  • Développer des API internes, des outils et des processus qui améliorent l'efficacité et réduisent les risques opérationnels.
  • Promouvoir les pratiques de développement logiciel et DevOps.
  • Enseigner, encadrer, développer et conseiller d'autres experts et équipes dans l'organisation.


🏅 À propos de vous:

  • Vous avez un minimum de 3 ans d'expérience.
  • Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme d'ingénieur ou équivalent.
  • Vous possédez des connaissances approfondies sur des sujets d'architecture tels que l'intégration, la sécurité, le réseau et la gestion des identités et des accès.
  • Vous maîtrisez les pratiques de l'artisanat logiciel, la programmation et les langages de script (Python, Java, Go, bash, PowerShell, ou équivalents).
  • Vous avez une solide expérience avec l'intégration continue et la livraison continue.
  • Vous avez de l'expérience avec les outils de gestion des infrastructures (surveillance et observabilité, journalisation, gestion de configuration, etc.).
  • Vous êtes un joueur d'équipe avec de fortes compétences en communication et interpersonnelles.
  • Vous êtes profondément curieux(se) et désireux(se) d'apprendre de nouvelles technologies et compétences.
  • Vous vous concentrez sur des stratégies proactives pour prévenir les problèmes avant qu'ils ne surviennent.
  • Vous parlez couramment français et anglais.



🤝 Pourquoi rejoindre Ivy Partners ?


Prendre soin de nos collaborateurs | Nous leur offrons un environnement bienveillant où chacun est valorisé, avec des formations et des opportunités d’évolution en Suisse et à l’international.


Créer un climat de confiance | Travailler avec nous, c’est construire une relation basée sur la transparence, le professionnalisme et l’engagement.


Encourager l’innovation | Nous allions technologie et créativité pour mener à bien des transformations numériques à fort impact.


Assumer nos responsabilités | Le collectif est au cœur de nos actions et nous mettons tout en œuvre pour générer un impact positif.

Title: Research Scientist, New View Synthesis and Reality Capture
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


PhD degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience coding in Python, JavaScript, R, Java, or C++.
One or more scientific publication submission(s) for conferences, journals, or public repositories.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience working in an industry or academic research lab, focusing on multiple aspects of the "research to product" pipeline.
Strong background in machine learning, computer vision, and deep learning, in particular around neural representations and 3D reconstruction, proven by publications and/or research artifacts.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


About The Job

As an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.

As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.

In this role, you will develop novel core tech around computer vision and ML, in particular scene and object understanding and 3D computer vision. Your role spans the whole range from research to product. You will serves multiple perception-related products at Google, with a particular focus on AR products and applications.

Responsibilities


Develop innovative computer vision and machine learning technology for applications in the field of augmented reality and beyond.
Lead productionization of innovative computer vision and ML technology in the area of 3DGS/NeRF/Neural Representations. Including development and optimization of the ML model, integration in a mobile framework, hillclimb and evaluation.
Establish and maintain relationships with main stakeholders and keep recurring updates on the advancements of the project, making sure that their expectations are aligned to the research and engineering work.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Machine Learning Scientist II
Description:
Expedia Group brands power global travel for everyone, everywhere. We design cutting-edge tech to make travel smoother and more memorable, and we create groundbreaking solutions for our partners. Our diverse, vibrant, and welcoming community is essential in driving our success.

Why Join Us?

To shape the future of travel, people must come first. Guided by our Values and Leadership Agreements, we foster an open culture where everyone belongs, differences are celebrated and know that when one of us wins, we all win.

We provide a full benefits package, including exciting travel perks, generous time-off, parental leave, a flexible work model (with some pretty cool offices), and career development resources, all to fuel our employees' passion for travel and ensure a rewarding career journey. We’re building a more open world. Join us.

Introduction to team 

Our Expedia Product & Technology division builds innovative products, services, and tools to deliver high-quality experiences for travelers, partners, and our employees. A unified, singular technology platform powered by data and machine learning provides secure, differentiated, and personalized experiences for the traveler and our partners that drive loyalty and customer satisfaction.  

The Machine Learning Scientist II role sits on the Pricing Machine Learning team in the Expedia Product & Technology division of Expedia Group. At the heart of the 3-side marketplace (the traveler, the property owners and the platform), this team develops and optimizes pricing models with state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to power Expedia competitiveness for the multiple brands and lines of business in our portfolio. 

In this role, your expertise and passion for innovation, developing cutting-edge technology and implementing industry-leading solutions, will improve the experience of millions of travelers and travel partners each year. This is an applied research role: your models will be deployed to our production systems and your results will be measured objectively via A/B testing, directly impacting our business results. We collaborate closely with the analytics, product, and engineering teams. 

In this role, you will: 

 


Work with product management to understand business problems, identify challenges and machine learning opportunities, and scope solutions. 
Conduct exploratory data analyses, formulate machine learning problems, and build effective models. 
Partner with data and software engineering teams to deliver your solutions into production. 
Document the technical details of your work. 
Present your ideas and results to product management, stakeholders, and leadership teams in a clear and effective manner. 
Collaborate and brainstorm with other team members and across the company. 


 

Who you are:  


You have a master's degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Engineering, or related technical field; or equivalent related professional experience 
You have solid understanding of modern machine learning techniques, statistics, and hypothesis testing. Preferred: You have experience in pricing systems. 
You have hands-on experience with data wrangling, feature engineering, model building, and visualization 
You have expertise with Python and related machine learning tools, deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, CatBoost, XGBoost, etc… and SQL-like query languages for data extraction, transformation, and loading 
Preferred: You have experience working with large data sets in a distributed computing environment such as Spark.  
You have passion for solving interesting and impactful real-world problems using principled techniques and best practices. 


Accommodation requests

If you need assistance with any part of the application or recruiting process due to a disability, or other physical or mental health conditions, please reach out to our Recruiting Accommodations Team through the Accommodation Request.

We are proud to be named as a Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2024 and be recognized for award-winning culture by organizations like Forbes, TIME, Disability:IN, and others.

Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™. © 2024 Expedia, Inc. All rights reserved. Trademarks and logos are the property of their respective owners. CST: 2029030-50

Employment opportunities and job offers at Expedia Group will always come from Expedia Group’s Talent Acquisition and hiring teams. Never provide sensitive, personal information to someone unless you’re confident who the recipient is. Expedia Group does not extend job offers via email or any other messaging tools to individuals with whom we have not made prior contact. Our email domain is @expediagroup.com. The official website to find and apply for job openings at Expedia Group is careers.expediagroup.com/jobs.

Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.

Title: Data Scientist 80-100%
Description:
Für unser Team Customer Analytics im Geschäftsbereich Club suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung am Standort Ostermundigen BE eine dynamische, engagierte und zielorientierte Persönlichkeit als Data Scientist.




Das können Sie bewegen

Extraktion, Analyse und Modellierung von Daten zur Unterstützung von Produktmanagement, Customer Experience, Marketing und Kampagnenmanagement
Erstellung, Validierung und laufende Optimierung von Affinity-Scores
Entwicklung von Predictive Models mit Hilfe moderner Machine-Learning-Methoden
Pflege und Weiterentwicklung von Datenpipelines und ETL-Prozessen
Visualisierung und Kommunikation komplexer Zusammenhänge mittels BI-Tools und zielgruppengerechtem Storytelling
Interpretation der Resultate und Ableitung datenbasierter Empfehlungen für Entscheidungsprozesse
Mitarbeit in bereichsübergreifenden Projekten, insbesondere bei der Integration neuer Datenquellen und Modellentwicklung




Damit gelingt Ihnen der Einstieg

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in Data Analytics und Machine Learning (z. B. Klassifikation, Regression, Clustering)
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie Erfahrung mit Python
Erfahrung mit Statistik- und Analyseplattformen wie SAS Viya, Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools
Verständnis für Datenmodellierung, Feature Engineering und Modellbewertung
Fähigkeit, komplexe Datenanalysen verständlich und zielgerichtet zu präsentieren
Hohe Kundenorientierung, Eigenverantwortung und Freude an interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit
Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse, gute Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil




Darauf können Sie sich freuen

Zentraler Arbeitsort mit guter ÖV-Anbindung
Moderner Arbeitsplatz
Internes Präventions- und Fitnessprogramm (Yoga, Pilates etc.)
Ein angenehmes und offenes Arbeitsklima sowie zeitgemässe Anstellungsbedingungen




Interessiert? Dann bewerben Sie sich noch heute und schreiben Sie mit uns TCS-Geschichte.




Beim TCS schätzen und respektieren wir vielfältige Lebenswege und die Diversität der Profile unserer Mitarbeitenden. Gleichbehandlung hat für uns oberste Priorität.




Francine Hänni, HR Business Partner, gibt Ihnen unter +41 58 827 30 05 gerne Auskunft zur Stelle.




Deshalb gibt es uns seit über 125 Jahren: Rund um den TCS Schweiz - TCS Schweiz




Touring Club Schweiz

Human Resources

Francine Hänni

Title: MLOps Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
Who we are

At viboo, we’re pioneering the way to operate commercial buildings. Since buildings are one of the largest sources of carbon emissions globally, we made it our mission to reduce their environmental impact. Our easy-to-retrofit, cloud and AI-native Building Management Systems (BMS) minimizes heating energy consumption while helping owners cut operational costs and enhance occupant comfort.

We're looking for an ML/MLOps Engineer to join our purpose-driven ETH spin-off—either immediately or by mutual agreement. In this role, your expertise in deploying, operating, and maintaining machine learning services will be instrumental in making our vision becoming reality.




About the job

As an ML/MLOps Engineer, you will be responsible for:

Designing, building, and maintaining end-to-end ML-pipelines using Kubeflow, ensuring scalability and robustness.
Implementing advanced testing strategies for ML-pipelines – such as simulation-based testing – to support continuous integration and ensure reliability.
Develop and maintain reliable deployment strategies for ML-pipelines and models (e.g. canary deployment).
Ensure consistent and reliable model operation across a variety of execution modes: scheduled jobs, integration within constrained optimization frameworks (Model Predictive Control), or real-time inference.
Implement and manage monitoring solutions to detect model drift, control performance drops, etc. using Grafana and Prometheus.
Orchestrate and manage containerized ML workloads using Kubernetes and Kubeflow on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Conducting peer reviews of code written by other developers, debugging issues, and optimizing overall platform performance.




What you offer

Background in Computer Science, Data Science, or related technical field.
5+ years of professional experience in MLOps, with a strong track record of delivering production-grade solutions.
Proven expertise in deploying and managing machine learning workloads using Kubernetes and Kubeflow. 
Hands-on experience in developing time series ML models, including feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and model evaluation in Python.
Experience working with public cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is an advantage.
Familiarity with monitoring and alerting tools. Grafana and Prometheus is beneficial.  
Experience with PostgreSQL or similar relational databases is considered a plus. 
Independent work style, hands-on mentality, and strong teamwork skills.
Fluent in English (at least C1 level) and excellent communication skills in general.




What we offer

An international, smart, and enthusiastic team with a clear vision.
A meaningful job in a DeepTech startup committed to sustainability.
Exciting insights into the rapidly growing and emerging AI industry.
Short decision paths, flat hierarchies, and the opportunity to shape the company.
Competitive salary package, including an employee stock option plan (ESOP).
Hybrid/remote work options and flexible working hours.
A steep learning curve to accelerate your career and individual training opportunities.
Regular team events.




Interested? Please send an email with your motivation and CV to benjamin.huber@viboo.io

Show more

  • Regular team events.


Interested? Please send an email with your motivation and CV to benjamin.huber@viboo.io

Title: Applied AI Engineer - 🤖 🇨🇭
Description:
Applied AI Engineer - 🚀 🤖 🇨🇭

🤫 Worum geht’s?

Wir sind ein wachsendes Unternehmen und auf der Suche nach talentierten Applied AI Engineers, die mit uns zusammen innovative, datengetriebene Lösungen für unsere Kunden entwickeln.

Dabei geht es um spannende Projekte im Bereich Künstliche Intelligenz (KI) und maschinelles Lernen (ML), die sowohl bestehende Prozesse optimieren als auch neue Geschäftsmöglichkeiten erschließen.

🤗 Bin ich der/die „Richtige“?

Du solltest etwa +/- 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich der AI- und ML-Entwicklung mitbringen. Idealerweise hast du Erfahrung in der Implementierung von Machine Learning Modellen (z.B. TensorFlow, PyTorch) und bist vertraut mit der Arbeit an kompletten ML-Pipelines, von der Datenaufbereitung bis hin zur Bereitstellung von Modellen in produktiven Umgebungen. Kenntnisse in Software-Engineering-Praktiken sind ebenfalls von Vorteil, insbesondere in Java, aber auch in weiteren Programmiersprachen wie z.B. Python, um kleinere Aufgaben schnell und effizient lösen zu können.

‍

Du strebst nach elegantem, optimiertem Code und kontinuierlicher Verbesserung deiner Fähigkeiten. Unsere erfahrenen Kollegen unterstützen dich dabei, und du gibst dieses Wissen gerne weiter. In a nutshell: Du kannst gut schlafen, wenn dein Code performant und gut getestet ist, und bist stolz auf deine Ergebnisse.

Zudem wirst du direkt mit unseren Kunden arbeiten, um ihre individuellen Herausforderungen zu verstehen und maßgeschneiderte AI-Lösungen zu entwickeln. Daher solltest du kommunikativ und aufgeschlossen sein. Unterstützung im Bereich Kundenhandling bekommst du von uns – und mit der Zeit wirst du auch in dieser Hinsicht immer sicherer.

‍

🏭 Wie arbeiten wir?

Wir folgen dem Prinzip: “Work is what you do, not where you do it”. Diese Flexibilität bieten wir dir auch, damit du dich voll auf deine Aufgaben als AI Engineer konzentrieren kannst, ohne Zeit durch unnötiges Pendeln zu verlieren.

‍

Ein paar Buzzwords aus unserem Tech-Stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn, Kubernetes, Docker, REST APIs, AWS, GCP, OpenAI, Git, MLOps.

🤓 Und wer seid ihr?

Unser Mantra: JUST FUCKING DO IT. Dieses Mantra findet sich nicht nur auf unserer kompletten Merch Collection als Aufdruck, sondern prägt unsere Company Kultur seit Anfang an. Unser Kunde hat ein scheinbar unlösbares Problem? Gibt’s nicht! Du stößt auf ein unlösbares technisches Problem? Gibt’s nicht, lösen wir zusammen! Du hast eine gute Idee und möchtest beispielsweise unsere Nerf Guns automatisiert über einen REST Service abgefeuert werden können? Wir sind dabei! Wenn du auch bei uns dabei sein möchtest, bewirb dich jetzt....

Unsere Benefits Findest Du Hier

https://software-brauerei.ch/jobs.html

‍

Bewirb dich jetzt!

Sende deine Bewerbung an jobs@software-brauerei.ch


Kurzes Motivationsschreiben
CV / Lebenslauf
Zeugnisse und Formalien
Arbeitsproben in Form z.B. von deinem Github, Projektübersicht


Wenn du Fragen hast, melde dich einfach bei uns!

P.S.: Bewerbungen, die mit &quotSehr geehrte Damen und Herren...&quot starten landen direkt im Papierkorb...

Zurück
